enclosure-glass.name: Glass Terrarium

budgetTiers.mid: Zoo Med ReptiBreeze or Exo Terra with front opening
budgetTiers.premium: Custom glass enclosure with sliding doors

enclosure-glass.notes: Glass enclosures retain heat and humidity well. Ensure mesh top for ventilation.

enclosure-pvc.name: PVC Enclosure

budgetTiers.premium: Custom PVC with sliding acrylic doors

enclosure-pvc.notes: PVC is lightweight, easy to clean, and excellent for humidity control. Ideal for larger setups.

enclosure-screen.name: Screen Enclosure
enclosure-screen.notes: Screen enclosures provide excellent ventilation but require more effort to maintain humidity. Best for species that need high airflow.

heat-lamp.name: Heat Lamp & Bulb

budgetTiers.mid: Zoo Med Mini Deep Dome + halogen

heat-lamp.notes: Use thermostat to prevent overheating. NO heat mats (burn risk). Ceramic Heat Emitter (CHE) or Deep Heat Projector (DHP) recommended with thermostat.

substrate-simple.name: Substrate
substrate-simple.notes: Avoid moss (bacteria/impaction risk). Use thick leaf litter layer to protect sensitive skin.

substrate-soil.name: Soil-Based Substrate

budgetTiers.premium: Premium organic soil blend with minerals

substrate-soil.notes: Good for plants and naturalistic setups. Ensure soil is fertilizer-free and pesticide-free.

substrate-paper.name: Paper-Based Substrate
substrate-paper.notes: Easy to replace and clean. Good for minimal setups. May need more frequent changes.

substrate-foam.name: Foam Substrate
substrate-foam.notes: Lightweight, reusable, and easy to clean. Great for enclosures where weight is a concern. Non-biodegradable.

drainage.name: Drainage Layer (LECA or clay balls)
drainage.notes: Essential for bioactive setups. Prevents water logging.

drainage-barrier.name: Drainage Barrier (mesh screen)
drainage-barrier.notes: Prevents substrate from mixing with drainage layer.

springtails.name: Springtail Culture
springtails.sizing: Standard for enclosures up to 36" Ã— 18"

isopods.name: Isopod Culture (Dwarf White or similar)
isopods.sizing: Tropical species suitable for higher humidity setups

branches.name: Climbing Branches & Perches
branches.notes: Cork bark, manzanita, or bamboo recommended. Whites Tree Frogs prefer horizontal perches.

plants.name: Plants (live or artificial)
plants.notes: Beginners: artificial plants are easier. Advanced: Pothos, ferns, bromeliads are good starter species.

plants-live.name: Live Plants
plants-live.notes: Excellent for bioactive setups and naturalistic aesthetics. Pothos, ferns, and bromeliads are reliable starter species.

plants-artificial.name: Artificial Plants
plants-artificial.notes: Easy to maintain, won't wilt, and great for minimalist or display-focused setups. Ensure materials are non-toxic.

misting-system.name: Automated Misting System
misting-system.notes: Ideal for high-humidity species. Allows consistent humidity levels without daily manual misting. Recommended timer: 1-3 minutes, 1-3 times daily.

humidifier.name: Ultrasonic or Cool Mist Humidifier
humidifier.notes: Effective for maintaining consistent ambient humidity. Ensure it's food-safe (no essential oils). Clean regularly to prevent mold.

fogger.name: Fogger (Ultrasonic Humidification)
fogger.notes: Creates fine mist for high humidity needs. Great for bioactive setups with plants. Use filtered water to prevent mineral buildup.

monitoring.name: Digital Thermometer & Hygrometer
monitoring.sizing: Monitor both warm and cool zones. Critical for temperature regulation.
